info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 29 at 4:59PM AST until April 29 at 7:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
FFWSJU
The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Utuado County in Puerto Rico...
* Until 700 PM AST.
* At 459 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, particularly along Rio Grande de Arecibo. Flood waters may affect portions of roads PR-10, PR-111, PR-123, PR-129, and PR-629 in Barrios Dampo Alegre, Barrio Jobos and Don Alonzo.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain and excessive runoff.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
